msContents.summary: Translation by Abū al-Fayz̤ ibn Mubārak Fayz̤ī (d. 1595) of Bhāskarācārya's Sanskrit work on geometry and arithmetic. The text is dedicated to a Muḥammad Shāh ruling in Lāhore, i.e. Bahādur Shāh I, 1643-1712 of the Mughal Empire.

persName.#text: Fayz̤ī, Abū al-Fayz̤ ibn Mubārak, 1547 or 1548-1595

supportDesc.extent: [2], 56, [2] foliated leaves : 215 x 155 (160 x 100) mm, bound to 220 x 165 mm

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink; pointed, unvocalized.

binding.p: Red half leather binding with marbled paper sides. Sewn on recessed supports with hollow spine. Gold fillet lines and titling on spine.
